avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs can still be released.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind slabs of last week can still be released, caution is to be exercised on steep, little used slopes at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example.
In some places the avalanches can be released in the faceted old snow and reach large size.

Backcountry touring calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.

snowpackStructure.comment: In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2000 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas at elevated altitudes hardly any snow is lying. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on old snow containing large grains.

tendency.highlights: The meteorological conditions will foster a gradual decrease in the danger of dry avalanches.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Weak layers in the old snowpack are difficult to recognise.
avalancheActivity.comment:
Weak layers in the old snowpack can still be released in some places in particular along the border with France. Avalanches can penetrate deep layers and reach medium size.
In addition the sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs should be taken into account.

In little used terrain the situation is more precarious. Snow sport activities are to be restricted to moderately steep terrain as far as possible.
In the other regions the avalanches are less common.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The fresh snow and the wind slabs are lying on a crust below approximately 2300 m.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, depending on the infuence of the wind. Field observations and artificially triggered avalanches have confirmed that the stability of the snowpack varies greatly within a small area.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas at elevated altitudes hardly any snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: The meteorological conditions will foster a gradual decrease in the danger of dry avalanches.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The avalanche prone locations are rather rare. Caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow and the mostly small wind slabs represent the main danger.
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in very isolated cases.

In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
In all altitude zones from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
